paper_abstract: This paper studies the linear programming (LP) relaxation of x(jt)-formulation of the single machine scheduling problem 1 vertical bar r(j)vertical bar Sigma w(j)C(j). The Lagrangian relaxation approach is proposed to cope with the computational difficulties for large problems. Since it can still be time consuming if highly accurate LP relaxation is required, the effect of approximate solution is studied with respect to the alpha-point heuristic. A two-stage proximal bundle algorithm is designed for the computation of the approximate solution. Results of numerical experiments show the efficiency of the proposed algorithm for large problems. paper_title: Computation of approximate alpha-points for large scale single machine scheduling problem
